headline: Security Best Practices You Should Know

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Implement security monitoring
digest_items.why: Real-time monitoring detects attacks and anomalies early
digest_items.fix: Use SIEM tools and set up alerts for suspicious activities

digest_items.title: Enable MFA for all admin accounts
digest_items.why: Multi-factor authentication prevents account takeover even if passwords are stolen
digest_items.fix: Use authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, Authy) or hardware keys (YubiKey)

digest_items.title: Use secure file upload validation
digest_items.why: Malicious file uploads can lead to remote code execution
digest_items.fix: Validate file types, scan for malware, and store uploads outside webroot

digest_items.title: Enable DNSSEC for your domain
digest_items.why: DNSSEC prevents DNS spoofing attacks by cryptographically signing DNS records
digest_items.fix: Contact your DNS provider to enable DNSSEC and add DS records to your registrar

digest_items.title: Use security champions program
digest_items.why: Embedded security advocates improve security culture across teams
digest_items.fix: Designate security champions in each team and provide training

digest_items.title: Implement network segmentation
digest_items.why: Segmentation limits lateral movement in case of breach
digest_items.fix: Separate production, staging, and development networks with firewalls
